today.prob: You've been struck from the rolls
today.copy: Even if you've voted in the past it is possible you've been removed from the voting rolls. There are a number of ways this can happen, such as changing addresses, technical glitches, and TK.

today.prob: You've moved or changed your name
today.copy: Moving down the street you could have crossed into a new election precinct, voting in the wrong precinct could lead to your ballot being challenged and your vote not counting. Many states allow for a 60-day grace period to vote using your old address, others may let you update your address on election day.

before_reg_deadline.copy: You can register online in 30 states. TKAll make forms available online that can be filled out and mailed in.
